meta_description: Located in the heart of Delaware County, PA, Tyler Arboretum's mission is to conserve our historic landscapes and connect people with the natural world. Today, Tyler serves the Greater Philadelphia region through horticulture, education, and the preservation of natural lands.
hours_text:
Visit Tyler Arboretum2024-10-04T11:46:19-04:00

# Visit Tyler Arboretum

With 650 protected acres of beautiful woodland, seasonally charming meadows, and a lively program of seasonal events and activities, Tyler Arboretum is a delight for nature lovers, birders, botanists, and those who want rediscover the natural world.

Just a 30-minute drive west from Philadelphia in Delaware County, Tyler Arboretum offers seasonally changing gardens, stands of towering trees (several of which are state champions), 17 miles of hiking trails, and a selection of historic buildings dating back to the 18th century.

Offering the perfect location for families with young children to discover the joy of the great outdoors, Tyler Arboretum is also an ideal venue for your celebratory events, whether that’s for a wedding or a party, or for your next business retreat.

Dating to 1681, making it one of the oldest public gardens in the United States, and home to eight generations of three families, Tyler Arboretum connects visitors to the region’s rich culture and history while preserving, developing, sharing, and celebrating Pennsylvania’s priceless horticultural heritage.

Visit Tyler today, and discover the wonders of the natural world in your own backyard.

accessibility_text:
Accessibility2019-12-10T13:54:01-05:00

# **Restrooms & Accessibility**

## **Restrooms**

Restrooms are available in the Barn on the main floor through the white door under the barn ramp, and on the top floor via the barn ramp when the barn loft is in use. Additional restrooms are available in the Edible Garden classroom at the bottom of the hill adjacent to the pond. Please note there are no other restroom facilities on the trails.

## ******Accessibility**

Tyler offers level and ramped access on paved paths through most of the inner core of our 650 acres site. There is level and gently ramped access from our parking lot, through our Visitor Center, to the main historic core of the site. Access to the lower and upper floors of the barn is either level or ramped. 

Our Scenic Loop is paved and mostly level although parts of the path include bridges over stream crossings, along with a few moderate grades. 

In several of our garden areas paths are commonly grassed or mulched with bark chippings which may offer limited accessibility for visitors who are wheelchair users. 

Our Fragrant Garden (located on the lower terrace to the side of the Barn) offers seasonal experiences for all visitors but may be particularly attractive to visitors with low vision or who are blind or partially sighted. While Tyler’s hiking trails are well-maintained, they are unpaved and may be best accessed by visitors with disabilities who are accompanied by a companion.

The mission of Tyler Arboretum is to conserve our historic landscapes and connect people with the natural world.
